alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:34PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rutland and southwestern Windsor Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 533 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Tabor, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and up to half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Windsor, Mount Holly, Ludlow, Cavendish, Mount Tabor, Weston, Andover, Ludlow Village, Perkinsville Village, Mt. Tabor, Reading, Baltimore, Springfield, Weathersfield, West Windsor, Wallingford, Hartland, Danby and Plymouth. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 40 and 49, and between mile markers 51 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern Vermont.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
